intro: Lophophyllum, commonly known as the mountain beauty, is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its botanical features include elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and fragrant, pinkish-white blossoms. Lophophyllum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats across the western United States and parts of Canada.
